Travel Agent / Sales Consultant - Fairfield CT Hospitality/Travel · Liberty Travel · Fairfield, CT Hospitality | Sales Consultant, Travel Agent Details Turn your passion for travel and your talent for sales into a career that really will take you places. At Liberty Travel you’ll have exciting opportunities and fantastic long term prospects. Why work for us? As an International Travel Consultant, you’ll be responsible for providing clients with the ability that really makes the difference to their holiday. You’ll be qualifying the client, making recommendations based on their needs and ensuring that you get all the information right so they go on holiday without a care in the world. This role has a strong focus on sales and. See more Sales Consultant, Travel Agent Jobs Turn your passion for travel and your talent for sales into a career that really will take you places. Respond Stop Fraud Report Learn More Marketplace User · 3 hours ago on Monster Travel Agent Hospitality/Travel · AAA North Jersey · Fair Lawn, NJ Hospitality | Travel Agent Details AAA North Jersey currently has a part-time position available in our World Wide Travel Agency located in our Fair Lawn office. Approx 21 hours a week. Hours are Monday 8:30 to 5:00pm or 11:30 to 8:00pm, Friday 8:30 to 5:00pm, and every Saturday 9:00am to 3:00pm. Duties include booking hotels, air, domestic/international car rentals and rail travel, vacation packages world wide and cruises. 2-5 yrs of leisure travel agency experience a must. Knowledge in Ms excel, Microsoft word, Internet, and Apollo reservations systems experience preferred. Please indicate salary qualifications when. Like a taxi cab, Redi Pedi pedicabs help people get from point A to point B is a bicycle with a carriage in the back. We are looking for energetic, self-motivated individuals to drive our pedicabs. A pedicab driver get paid by his or her passengers and make about $10 - $20 an hour on average working 5 days a week. Corporate Travel Agent - Senior Hospitality/Travel · BCD Travel Corporate · Mc Lean, VA Hospitality | Travel Agent Details BCD Travel is searching for an experienced Corporate Travel Agent for an onsite location in McLean, VA. This position will be responsible for fulling Corporate Travel Customers' travel related requests in airline ticketing arrangements, hotel accommodations and car rentals. U.S Citizenship is required. Essential Duties and Assignments include: - Books reservations for air travel, hotel and car rentals, following up when necessary to complete the reservation. - Responds to requests for price quotations utilizing automated system(s) for domestic and international itineraries. - Promotes the acceptance of fares, rates, and suppliers that match the client's travel program policies and negotiated contracts. Some Modeling Hospitality/Travel · Road Rat Motors · Gainesville, FL Hospitality | Help Run Pool Parties - Both Details Here's the deal. We will be throwing some pool parties around Gainesville throughout the summer and fall. We're looking for both guys and girls to represent our company at these parties. To fit in with the crowd, you'll be wearing a bikini or board shorts to the pool party, interact with the college students, pose for pictures, give away free stuff, and just have an overall good time. To apply, please email us your name, email address, phone number, and address. We are looking for 5-10 people total so if you have friends that are interested, feel free to have them apply as well. It should be a good time for everyone while you make a little money at the same time! We'll also use these people for a few photo shoots on our products around town.. Hereford, Canyon, and Vernon, TX - Event Specialists needed Hospitality/Travel · Childress, TX Hospitality | Hereford Canyon and Vernon TX Details Advantage Sales and Marketing, currently has a number of immediate openings throughout the local area. We are looking for outgoing and energetic individuals to conduct in-store demonstrations in major local retailers. As an Event Specialist/Product Demonstrator you will conduct in-store demonstrations, for both food and non-food products, to generate excitement, brand awareness, and drive sales through event execution and promotions. This fun and exciting opportunity will give you a chance to show-off your sales and customer service skills through interaction with consumers. If you like to interact with people and get excited about trying new things, then this opportunity is for you! Duties and Responsibilities -Engage consumers and promote new and exciting products in store -Educate yourself on new products and communicate features and benefits to consumers -Build strong relationships with store managers and personnel -Report event activity on a daily basis through an online reporting system -Set-up. So I am lowering the price (AGAIN). 8700.00 My food truck just been taken off the road, but I am not able to devote enough time to make this more successful. I’ve got some medical stuff pending. IF YOU THINK YOU ARE A BETTER COOK THAN YOUR BOSS, this is a cheap-chance to prove it. This is an excellent opportunity for 2 people to reach the amazing food truck potential. The truck is a 20 ft. long converted RV, It is an Eldorado on a GMC frame&was the top of the line. It has around 52,000 miles. Everything works including the dash a/c. This comes fully equipped, ready to open tomorrow, in fact I have been setting up since May, but the locations I’ve chosen have all fizzled. My bad, but I don’t have the youth or energy to drive to the crowds. This isn't a brand new stainless steel food network unit, but it has everything you need&obviously cheaper.. Travel Agent Hospitality/Travel · New York, NY Hospitality | Travel Agent Details Job Purpose: Guides travelers by identifying itineraries; booking reservations. Duties: * Clarifies travel preferences by determining travel dates and destination, mode of transportation, and finances. * Develops itinerary by assembling literature; offering personal experiences; commenting on local customs, points of interest, and special events; answering inquiries; offering suggestions. * Schedules itinerary by identifying, booking, and confirming route, carriers, lodging, and dining; verifying space and rates; issuing tickets. * Completes foreign travel qualifications by obtaining visa, permit, and medical regulations; completing forms; providing details to obtain currency. * Prepares travel packet by assembling itinerary, maps, tickets, confirmations, visas and related documents, baggage tags, emergency resources, insurance.
